name: libreadline-java
description: Port of GNU readline for Java

repo.name: java-readline
repo.description: GNU readline and BSD editline wrappers for Java

readme.summary: Documentation provides basic compilation instructions but lacks clear quick-start examples, modern installation guidance, and troubleshooting beyond licensing concerns.
readme.top_issue: No code examples showing actual usage of the JavaReadline API - users must read separate API docs to understand how to use the library in their programs

injection_risks.description: The eval() method can evaluate arbitrary Java code, which poses a significant injection risk if user input is not properly sanitized.
The source() method can execute scripts from files or streams, which may lead to code injection vulnerabilities if the input is not validated.

critical_findings: High-risk injection vulnerability in the eval() method
Potential code injection vulnerabilities in the source() method
security.summary: The libreadline-java package has significant security concerns, including high-risk injection vulnerabilities and lack of input validation, which require immediate attention to prevent potential attacks.

common_complaints: Build failures with modern GCC versions
Type mismatches with readline library internals
Lack of maintenance for compatibility with updated dependencies
sentiment.summary: libreadline-java shows signs of abandonment with unresolved build compatibility issues against GCC 14 and readline 7.0, indicating the project is no longer actively maintained.

communication.summary: The maintainer's responses are clear, helpful, and demonstrate a good level of technical depth while being patient with new contributors.

concerns: No active contributors in past 6 months
No merged PRs in past 6 months
No closed issues in past 6 months
Last commit over a month ago with no follow-up activity
maintenance.summary: libreadline-java shows clear signs of abandonment with zero maintenance activity over the past 6 months and unresolved issues accumulating.

analysis_summary.doc_summary: The documentation is mostly clear and provides good installation instructions, but lacks a quick start guide and troubleshooting information.
concerns: Long time since last release (6 months)
Docs: Lack of a quick start example to help new users get started with the package.
Security: High-risk injection vulnerability in the eval() method
Security: Potential code injection vulnerabilities in the source() method
Security: The eval() method can evaluate arbitrary Java code, which poses a significant injection risk if user input is not properly sanitized.

Security: The libreadline-java package has significant security concerns, including high-risk injection vulnerabilities and lack of input validation, which require immediate attention to prevent potential attacks.
highlights: Recent commit in the past month
